page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Burntwood is an urban parish of 3,719 acres, consisting of Chasetown, Chase Terrace and Burntwood.Adjacent is the parish of Hammerwich. The parishes lie north of the Black Country and to the south of Cannock Chase. Until the opening of the first coal pits in 1849, the population of approx. 700 was housed in the four main hamlets of Burntwood, Edial, Woodhouses and Hammerwich, and the main industry was nailmaking. The local coal industry brought about a rapid population rise to over 8,000. Today there are approx. 30,000 residents in the area. The parish has good shopping facilities, a public library, 3 parks and a large recreation centre. There are also 10 churches of different denominations. Nearby, the Chasewater resevoir has become a favourite resort for water sports.
